Harlequin Ichthyosis.description: a severe genetic skin disorder characterized by thick, diamond-shaped plates of skin separated by deep cracks
Harlequin Ichthyosis.symptoms: Thick, plate-like skin, deep red cracks between plates, ectropion (eyelids turned outward), eclabium (lips turned outward), breathing difficulties
Harlequin Ichthyosis.treatment: Intensive neonatal care, humidified incubator, topical emollients, systemic retinoids, careful monitoring of temperature and hydration

Progeria (Hutchinson-Gilford Syndrome).description: an extremely rare genetic disorder that causes rapid aging in children
Progeria (Hutchinson-Gilford Syndrome).symptoms: Growth failure, loss of body fat, hair loss, aged-looking skin, stiff joints, hip dislocation, generalized atherosclerosis, cardiovascular disease
Progeria (Hutchinson-Gilford Syndrome).treatment: Symptomatic management, low-dose aspirin, physical therapy, feeding tube if necessary, ongoing cardiac care

Fibrodysplasia Ossificans Progressiva.description: a rare genetic disorder where soft tissue gradually turns into bone
Fibrodysplasia Ossificans Progressiva.symptoms: Malformed big toes at birth, painful soft tissue swellings that ossify, progressive loss of mobility, formation of extra-skeletal bone
Fibrodysplasia Ossificans Progressiva.treatment: No cure exists, management focuses on preventing injury that might trigger flare-ups, corticosteroids during flare-ups, avoiding biopsies and surgeries

Alkaptonuria.description: a rare inherited genetic disorder where the body cannot break down certain amino acids
Alkaptonuria.symptoms: Darkening of urine when exposed to air, dark pigmentation of connective tissues (ochronosis), arthritis in spine and large joints, heart valve problems
Alkaptonuria.treatment: Pain management for arthritis, physical therapy, limited protein diet, vitamin C supplementation, joint replacement surgery if needed

Xeroderma Pigmentosum.description: a rare genetic disorder characterized by extreme sensitivity to ultraviolet light
Xeroderma Pigmentosum.symptoms: Severe sunburn after minimal sun exposure, freckling at an early age, dry skin, changes in skin pigmentation, high risk of skin cancers, eye problems
Xeroderma Pigmentosum.treatment: Complete protection from UV light, protective clothing, sunscreen, regular skin exams, early treatment of precancerous lesions, genetic counseling
Xeroderma Pigmentosum.prevalence: 1 in 1,000,000 people in US and Europe

Fields Disease.description: an extremely rare neuromuscular disease that affects only two known patients worldwide
Fields Disease.symptoms: Progressive muscle weakness, difficulty with motor skills, muscle twitching, respiratory difficulties
Fields Disease.treatment: Symptomatic treatment, physical therapy, respiratory support

Methemoglobinemia.description: a blood disorder where abnormal amounts of methemoglobin are produced
Methemoglobinemia.symptoms: Cyanosis (bluish skin), headache, fatigue, shortness of breath, lack of energy
Methemoglobinemia.treatment: Methylene blue, ascorbic acid, hyperbaric oxygen therapy, blood transfusion in severe cases

Aquagenic Urticaria.description: an extremely rare form of physical urticaria where contact with water causes hives
Aquagenic Urticaria.symptoms: Itching, burning, red skin, hives after contact with water regardless of temperature
Aquagenic Urticaria.treatment: Antihistamines, UV therapy, barrier creams, capsaicin cream, omalizumab
Aquagenic Urticaria.prevalence: Approximately 50 cases reported in medical literature

Stoneman Syndrome.description: a disorder in which muscle tissue and connective tissue such as tendons and ligaments are gradually replaced by bone
Stoneman Syndrome.symptoms: Malformation of big toes, painful soft tissue swellings, progressive loss of mobility, extra bone formation
Stoneman Syndrome.treatment: No cure, management focuses on preventing injury, corticosteroids during flare-ups

Kuru.description: a rare, fatal neurodegenerative disorder caused by prions, formerly common among the Fore people of Papua New Guinea
Kuru.symptoms: Body tremors, loss of coordination, difficulty walking, involuntary movements, dementia

Microcephaly.description: a rare neurological condition where an infant's head is significantly smaller than expected
Microcephaly.symptoms: Small head size, developmental delays, intellectual disability, poor motor function, dwarfism
Microcephaly.treatment: Early intervention programs, speech therapy, physical therapy, occupational therapy

Parry-Romberg Syndrome.description: a rare disorder characterized by progressive shrinkage and degeneration of tissues beneath the skin
Parry-Romberg Syndrome.symptoms: Facial atrophy, seizures, facial pain, hair loss, dental abnormalities, eye problems
Parry-Romberg Syndrome.treatment: Reconstructive surgery, fat grafts, medications for pain and seizures, dental care

Alice in Wonderland Syndrome.description: a rare neurological disorder characterized by distortions of visual perception
Alice in Wonderland Syndrome.symptoms: Distorted body image, micropsia, macropsia, distorted sense of time, visual hallucinations
Alice in Wonderland Syndrome.treatment: Treatment of underlying cause, migraine prophylaxis, reassurance

Argyria.description: a condition caused by excessive exposure to silver, resulting in blue or gray discoloration of the skin
Argyria.symptoms: Blue-gray skin discoloration, particularly in sun-exposed areas, may be generalized or localized
Argyria.treatment: No effective treatment, prevention, laser therapy may help in some cases

Auto-brewery Syndrome.description: a rare condition where ethanol is produced through endogenous fermentation by fungi or bacteria in the gastrointestinal system
Auto-brewery Syndrome.symptoms: Signs of alcohol intoxication without consuming alcohol, dizziness, dry mouth, hangovers, disorientation, chronic fatigue syndrome
Auto-brewery Syndrome.treatment: Antifungal medications, low-carbohydrate diet, probiotics, treatment of underlying conditions
Auto-brewery Syndrome.prevalence: Extremely rare, only about 20 cases reported in medical literature

Congenital Insensitivity to Pain.description: a rare condition where a person cannot feel physical pain
Congenital Insensitivity to Pain.symptoms: Inability to feel physical pain, self-injury, repeated severe injuries, corneal damage, bone fractures
Congenital Insensitivity to Pain.treatment: Preventive care, regular medical checkups, protective measures, dental care, psychological support
Congenital Insensitivity to Pain.prevalence: Extremely rare, only about 20 cases documented in US

Hereditary Angioedema.description: a rare genetic disorder characterized by recurrent episodes of severe swelling in various parts of the body
Hereditary Angioedema.symptoms: Swelling in hands, feet, face, airway, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, airway obstruction
Hereditary Angioedema.treatment: C1 esterase inhibitor, icatibant, ecallantide, fresh frozen plasma, androgens, prophylactic treatment

Möbius Syndrome.description: a rare neurological disorder characterized by facial paralysis and inability to move the eyes from side to side
Möbius Syndrome.symptoms: Facial paralysis, inability to form facial expressions, feeding difficulties, speech difficulties, eye problems
Möbius Syndrome.treatment: Supportive care, speech therapy, physical therapy, eye protection, reconstructive surgery

Porphyria.description: a group of rare disorders caused by deficiencies in enzymes involved in heme production
Porphyria.symptoms: Abdominal pain, chest pain, vomiting, confusion, constipation, tachycardia, hypertension, skin blisters
Porphyria.treatment: Hemin, glucose loading, pain management, avoidance of triggers, sun protection
Porphyria.prevalence: 1 in 500 to 1 in 50,000 people depending on type

Lesch-Nyhan Syndrome.description: a rare inherited disorder caused by deficiency of the enzyme hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase
Lesch-Nyhan Syndrome.symptoms: Neurological disability, self-mutilation, aggressive behavior, gout, impaired kidney function, speech impairment
Lesch-Nyhan Syndrome.treatment: Allopurinol, behavioral management, physical restraints, medication for behavior, supportive care

Epidermolysis Bullosa.description: a group of rare diseases that cause fragile, blistering skin
Epidermolysis Bullosa.symptoms: Fragile skin that blisters easily, blisters inside the mouth and throat, thickened skin and nails, hair loss, thin-appearing skin
Epidermolysis Bullosa.treatment: Wound care, protective bandaging, pain management, nutritional support, avoiding skin trauma, potential gene therapy or bone marrow transplantation

Necrotizing Fasciitis.description: a rare bacterial infection that spreads quickly in the body and can cause death
Necrotizing Fasciitis.symptoms: Rapidly spreading inflammation, severe pain, fever, redness, swelling, purple patches, blisters
Necrotizing Fasciitis.treatment: Emergency surgery, intravenous antibiotics, supportive care, hyperbaric oxygen therapy

Stevens-Johnson Syndrome.description: a rare, serious disorder of the skin and mucous membranes
Stevens-Johnson Syndrome.symptoms: Facial swelling, tongue swelling, hives, skin pain, red or purple skin rash, blisters, shedding of skin
Stevens-Johnson Syndrome.treatment: Hospitalization, stopping causative medication, pain medication, antibiotics, IV fluids, wound care

Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis.description: a life-threatening skin disorder characterized by blistering and peeling of the skin
Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis.symptoms: Widespread skin pain, rash, blisters, peeling of large areas of skin, fever, malaise
Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis.treatment: ICU care, stopping causative drug, wound care, pain management, IV fluids, infection control

Wilson's Disease.description: a rare inherited disorder that causes copper to accumulate in the liver, brain and other vital organs
Wilson's Disease.symptoms: Fatigue, lack of appetite, abdominal pain, jaundice, golden-brown eye discoloration, fluid buildup, speech problems
Wilson's Disease.treatment: Penicillamine, trientine, zinc acetate, liver transplant in severe cases, low-copper diet

Addison's Disease.description: a rare disorder characterized by inadequate production of cortisol and aldosterone by the adrenal glands
Addison's Disease.symptoms: Extreme fatigue, weight loss, low blood pressure, darkening of skin, salt craving, low blood sugar, nausea
Addison's Disease.treatment: Hormone replacement therapy, hydrocortisone, fludrocortisone, emergency injection for crisis

Cushing's Syndrome.description: a rare disorder caused by prolonged exposure to high levels of cortisol
Cushing's Syndrome.symptoms: Weight gain, fatty hump between shoulders, rounded face, pink or purple stretch marks, slow healing, acne
Cushing's Syndrome.treatment: Surgery, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, cortisol-inhibiting medications, reducing corticosteroid use

Gaucher's Disease.description: a rare genetic disorder where fatty substances accumulate in cells and certain organs
Gaucher's Disease.symptoms: Abdominal complaints, skeletal abnormalities, anemia, fatigue, easy bruising, enlarged liver and spleen
Gaucher's Disease.treatment: Enzyme replacement therapy, miglustat, eliglustat, bone marrow transplant, pain medication

Huntington's Disease.description: a rare, inherited disease that causes the progressive breakdown of nerve cells in the brain
Huntington's Disease.symptoms: Involuntary movements, impaired coordination, difficulty reasoning, mood changes, depression, irritability
Huntington's Disease.treatment: No cure, tetrabenazine for movements, antidepressants, antipsychotics, speech therapy, physical therapy

Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease.description: a rare, degenerative, fatal brain disorder that affects about one person in every one million per year
Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease.symptoms: Memory problems, behavioral changes, poor coordination, visual disturbances, involuntary movements, blindness
Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease.treatment: No cure, focused on alleviating symptoms, pain medication, clonazepam or sodium valproate for myoclonus

Elephantiasis.description: a rare disease characterized by gross enlargement of an area of the body, especially the limbs
Elephantiasis.symptoms: Swelling and thickening of skin and underlying tissues, especially in legs, arms, genitals, and breasts
Elephantiasis.treatment: Antiparasitic drugs, antibiotics, surgery in severe cases, compression therapy, elevation, hygiene measures
Elephantiasis.prevalence: Varies by region, 120 million people infected worldwide in endemic areas

Marfan Syndrome.description: a genetic disorder that affects the body's connective tissue
Marfan Syndrome.symptoms: Tall and slender build, disproportionately long arms and legs, curved spine, chest sinks or sticks out, heart murmurs
Marfan Syndrome.treatment: Regular monitoring, beta blockers, surgery to repair aorta, eye care, bone strengthening medications

Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome.description: a group of inherited disorders that affect connective tissues, primarily skin, joints and blood vessel walls
Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome.symptoms: Overly flexible joints, stretchy skin, fragile skin, delayed wound healing, atrophic scarring, chronic pain
Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome.treatment: Physical therapy, bracing, pain management, cardiovascular monitoring, surgical repair of joints

Osteogenesis Imperfecta.description: a group of genetic disorders that mainly affect the bones, resulting in bones that break easily
Osteogenesis Imperfecta.symptoms: Frequent bone fractures, short stature, hearing loss, breathing problems, loose joints, blue sclera
Osteogenesis Imperfecta.treatment: Bisphosphonates, physical therapy, mobility aids, surgery to strengthen bones, fracture care

Tay-Sachs Disease.description: a rare inherited disorder that progressively destroys nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord
Tay-Sachs Disease.symptoms: Exaggerated startle response, loss of motor skills, increasing weakness, loss of vision, deafness, paralysis
Tay-Sachs Disease.treatment: Supportive care, respiratory care, feeding tubes, medication for seizures, physical therapy

Niemann-Pick Disease.description: a group of severe inherited metabolic disorders where sphingomyelin accumulates in lysosomes in cells
Niemann-Pick Disease.symptoms: Loss of motor skills, enlarged liver and spleen, feeding difficulties, learning disabilities, seizures, eye problems
Niemann-Pick Disease.treatment: Miglustat, supportive care, physical therapy, occupational therapy, anti-seizure medications

Kawasaki Disease.description: a rare childhood illness that causes inflammation in the walls of blood vessels throughout the body
Kawasaki Disease.symptoms: High fever, rash, swollen hands and feet, red eyes, red cracked lips, swollen lymph nodes, irritability
Kawasaki Disease.treatment: Intravenous immunoglobulin, high-dose aspirin, corticosteroids in some cases, follow-up heart exams

Goodpasture Syndrome.description: a rare autoimmune disorder in which antibodies attack the basement membrane in lungs and kidneys
Goodpasture Syndrome.symptoms: Fatigue, nausea, difficulty breathing, pale skin, bloody sputum, burning with urination, high blood pressure
Goodpasture Syndrome.treatment: Plasmapheresis, corticosteroids, cyclophosphamide, dialysis, kidney transplant, smoking cessation

Wegener's Granulomatosis.description: a rare disorder that causes inflammation of blood vessels, restricting blood flow to various organs
Wegener's Granulomatosis.symptoms: Persistent runny nose, nosebleeds, sinus infections, cough, shortness of breath, joint pain, skin sores
Wegener's Granulomatosis.treatment: Corticosteroids, cyclophosphamide, rituximab, methotrexate, antibiotics for infections

Behçet's Disease.description: a rare disorder that causes blood vessel inflammation throughout the body
Behçet's Disease.symptoms: Mouth sores, eye inflammation, skin rashes, genital sores, joint swelling, gastrointestinal problems
Behçet's Disease.treatment: Corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, colchicine, interferon alfa-2b, TNF inhibitors
Behçet's Disease.prevalence: 5-10 per 100,000 people in Middle East and Asia

Sarcoidosis.description: a disease characterized by the growth of tiny collections of inflammatory cells in any part of the body
Sarcoidosis.symptoms: Fatigue, fever, swollen lymph nodes, weight loss, persistent dry cough, shortness of breath, skin lesions
Sarcoidosis.treatment: Corticosteroids, methotrexate, hydroxychloroquine, TNF inhibitors, organ-specific treatments

Scleroderma.description: a group of rare diseases that involve the hardening and tightening of the skin and connective tissues
Scleroderma.symptoms: Hardened skin, Raynaud's phenomenon, heartburn, difficulty swallowing, shortness of breath, high blood pressure
Scleroderma.treatment: Immunosuppressants, physical therapy, light therapy, blood pressure medications, stomach acid reducers

Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS).description: a progressive nervous system disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord
Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS).symptoms: Difficulty walking, weakness in legs, hand weakness, slurred speech, muscle cramps, difficulty holding head up
Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS).treatment: Riluzole, edaravone, physical therapy, speech therapy, nutritional support, breathing support

Multiple System Atrophy.description: a rare neurodegenerative disorder characterized by autonomic dysfunction, tremors, slow movement, and muscle rigidity
Multiple System Atrophy.symptoms: Orthostatic hypotension, urinary incontinence, constipation, muscle rigidity, tremors, slow movement, imbalance
Multiple System Atrophy.treatment: Fludrocortisone, midodrine, levodopa, catheterization, physical therapy, speech therapy

Primary Immunodeficiency Diseases.description: a group of more than 400 rare, chronic disorders where part of the body's immune system is missing or functions improperly
Primary Immunodeficiency Diseases.symptoms: Frequent infections, infections that don't respond to treatment, poor growth, autoimmunity, inflammation
Primary Immunodeficiency Diseases.treatment: Immunoglobulin therapy, antibiotic prophylaxis, stem cell transplantation, gene therapy

Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension.description: a rare, progressive disorder characterized by high blood pressure in the arteries of the lungs
Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension.symptoms: Shortness of breath, fatigue, dizziness, fainting, chest pressure, swelling in ankles and legs, bluish lips
Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension.treatment: Calcium channel blockers, endothelin receptor antagonists, phosphodiesterase inhibitors, prostacyclin analogs

Cystic Fibrosis.description: a hereditary disorder that affects the lungs and digestive system, causing mucus to become thick and sticky
Cystic Fibrosis.symptoms: Persistent cough, wheezing, recurrent lung infections, poor growth, greasy stools, nasal polyps, clubbed fingers
Cystic Fibrosis.treatment: Airway clearance techniques, bronchodilators, antibiotics, pancreatic enzyme supplements, CFTR modulators

Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy.description: a genetic disorder characterized by progressive muscle degeneration and weakness
Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy.symptoms: Frequent falls, difficulty rising, waddling gait, large calf muscles, learning disabilities, cardiac problems
Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy.treatment: Corticosteroids, physical therapy, respiratory care, cardiac care, orthopedic devices, surgery

Myasthenia Gravis.description: a chronic autoimmune neuromuscular disease that causes weakness in the skeletal muscles
Myasthenia Gravis.symptoms: Drooping eyelids, double vision, difficulty speaking, difficulty swallowing, weakness in arms and legs
Myasthenia Gravis.treatment: Cholinesterase inhibitors, corticosteroids, immunosuppressants, plasmapheresis, intravenous immunoglobulin

Phenylketonuria (PKU).description: a rare inherited disorder that causes an amino acid called phenylalanine to build up in the body
Phenylketonuria (PKU).symptoms: Intellectual disability, behavioral problems, seizures, hyperactivity, musty odor, skin rashes, small head size
Phenylketonuria (PKU).treatment: Lifelong low-phenylalanine diet, special medical formula, medication (sapropterin), close monitoring

Galactosemia.description: a rare genetic metabolic disorder that affects an individual's ability to metabolize galactose properly
Galactosemia.symptoms: Vomiting, diarrhea, lethargy, failure to thrive, jaundice, liver damage, bleeding, infections
Galactosemia.treatment: Lifelong galactose-free diet, calcium supplements, speech therapy, occupational therapy, hormone treatment

Maple Syrup Urine Disease.description: a rare inherited disorder where the body cannot process certain amino acids properly
Maple Syrup Urine Disease.symptoms: Poor feeding, vomiting, lack of energy, seizures, coma, developmental delay, maple syrup odor in urine
Maple Syrup Urine Disease.treatment: Lifelong protein-restricted diet, special medical formula, close monitoring, hospitalization during illness

Homocystinuria.description: an inherited disorder that prevents the body from processing the amino acid methionine properly
Homocystinuria.symptoms: Dislocation of lens in eye, nearsightedness, abnormal blood clots, osteoporosis, learning disabilities
Homocystinuria.treatment: High-dose vitamin B6, low-methionine diet, betaine, cysteine supplement, blood thinners
